summary: Analysis of updated Perplexity AI Legal Policies reveals a new Privacy Policy (updated February 2nd, 2025) and an updated Acceptable Use Policy (updated July 8th, 2025).  The Terms of Service (last updated June 4th, 2024) remain largely unchanged.  The Privacy Policy details data collection, usage, and disclosure practices, emphasizing compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and the Data Privacy Framework. The Acceptable Use Policy outlines restrictions on illegal activities, high-risk activities, and technical misuse of the service.

changes: Detailed explanation of data collection methods (information provided directly, automatically collected usage data, and information from other sources).
Clear description of data usage for various purposes (contract fulfillment, legitimate interests, compliance, etc.).
Specification of data disclosure to third parties (affiliates, service providers, business partners, etc.).
Emphasis on compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and the Data Privacy Framework.
Outline of user rights (access, deletion, correction, portability, etc.).
Information on data security and retention policies.
Specific provisions for California residents, including CCPA compliance.
Privacy Policy.impact: Significant improvement in transparency regarding data handling practices. Enhanced user control and awareness of their rights.

changes: Clearer articulation of prohibited activities, categorized into legal compliance, high-risk activities, and technical misuse.
Specific examples provided for each category of prohibited activity.
Emphasis on responsible AI use and compliance with regulations like the EU AI Act.
Clarification on exceptions to the policy and the consequences of non-compliance.
Acceptable Use Policy.impact: Improved clarity and structure, enhancing user understanding of acceptable usage boundaries.  Strengthened commitment to responsible AI development and deployment.

Terms of Service.changes: No significant changes detected in the provided excerpt.
Terms of Service.impact: Maintains the existing framework for user agreement and service provision.
